item.title: Report X-2023030922
item.description:
Report X-2023030922

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-09T06:11:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-18
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: ANCIP station was building up a jerrican onto a pallet when they noticed an odor, further investigation they found that this jerrican had developed a small leak on the bottom. It is unknown how the lead developed. The jerrican contained UN3286, CORROSIVE LIQUID, BASIC, INORGANIC, N.O.S, 8, III. DG Admin was called and the spill was cleaned up and the package was placed in a salvage drum. The shipper is being contacted for disposition of the package.

item.title: Report X-2023030593
item.description:
Report X-2023030593

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-09T06:11:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-03-09
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/8/23 at approximately 1900 Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the hub facilty in Anchorage, reporting an undeclared dangerous goods spill. The shipment consisted of 3 fiberboard boxes, each containing Part A and part B of moisture vapor barrier primer. One of the packages were discovered leaking during sort. Further investigation revealed that the inner contents has completely spilled; cause unknown. The shipment wad tendered under Special Provision A197, however, the inner contents exceed the maximum amount allowed under the Special Provision. As a result, this shipment is classifed as an undeclared dangerous goods shipment. The two accompanying package have been delivered. The damaged shipment has been placed in a salvage drum, being prepared fro disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023020833
item.description:
Report X-2023020833

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-09T06:11:05+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-02-16
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ANCHORAGE, ALASKA, THREE 18 GALLON PLASTIC STORAGE TOTES GOING TO QUALITY HOMES IN PALMER, ALASKA WERE FOUND TO CONTAIN VARIOUS UNDECLARED CONTENTS. THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED IN TRACKING NUMBER 1ZR170450394544213 CONTAINED THIRTY BOTTLES OF VARIOUS SMOKELESS POWDERS. TRACKING NUMBER 1ZR170450327873878 CRACKED OPEN EXPOSING THE CONTENTS WHICH CONTAINED APPROXIMATELY SIXTY BOXES OF CARTRIDGES, SMALL ARMS. TRACKING NUMBER 1ZR170450394542377 CONTAINED FIVE BOXES OF PRIMERS, CAP TYPE. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON ANY OF THE OUTER TOTES TO INDICATE HAZARDOUS MATERIALS WERE BEING SHIPPED. THE PACKAGES WERE SHIPPED THROUGH THE UPS STORE BY STEPHEN OSTRANDER WITH A SERVICE LEVEL OF GROUND TO ALASKA.

  • Description: On 2/8/2023 at approximately 1200, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 261690 at the hub facility in Anchorage, reporting a undeclared alcohol shipment. The shipment consisted of 4 plastic bottles packed inside of a fiberboard box. The package had a ground limited quantity mark printed on the outside of the package, indicating that the contents are potentially dangerous goods. Further investigation confirmed the suspicions. The shipment is being held , pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2023010676
item.description:
Report X-2023010676

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-18
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: spilldevgrp@fedex.com
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: An employee at our ANCIP station encountered a multipiece shipment that had 1 package leaking. There were six packages total, each containing 16 inner receptacles. The package that was found to have leaked was opened and 3 inner receptacles were found to have leaked. Approximately 0.9L of UN1805 Phosphoric acid, solution, 8, PGIII leaked out of the receptacles combined. It is unknown what exactly cause the inner receptacles to leak, as there was no damage to the outer package. DG Admin advised the employee to place that package into a salvage drum and to hold the shipment until further notice.

  • Description: On 12/08/2022 at approximately 0900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 294822 at the hub facility in Anchorage, reporting an undeclared paint spill. The shipment consisted of plastic drum that was overpacked into a fiberboard box. The shipment was discovered leaking. Further research revealed that the plastic drum was cracked which resulted in the leak. the cause of the damage is unknown. The shipment marked or labeled as required by IATA Regulations. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: Aircraft N403YK was loaded for a flight to PADG. The flight departed normally from PANC. On climb out the crew noticed a fume smell coming from the cargo compartment. They verified the dangerous goods with the flight support (load master) and decided to return to PANC to address the issue. The crew did declare an emergency and landed uneventfully. The cargo team cleaned up the small amount of spilled diesel fuel and drained more out of the generator. After discussing with the flight crew the cargo was reloaded and the flight was completed.

item.title: Report X-2022101131
item.description:
Report X-2022101131

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-23
  • City: NOME
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: customer came in to ship 4000lbs of equipment with multiple cases containing lithium batteries packed with equipment. we have had issues with this shipper all summer not knowing the correct packaging and shipping labels for lithium batteries. when they dropped this shipment off they said that all the cases were labeled correctly - I went back to the warehouse to look and noticed there were multiple cases that had damaged or torn DG Lit battery labels. I advised the shipper they needed to have labels that were not torn or damaged. I actually took her back to the warehouse so she could see that they were not labeled correctly. Her and her helper then sorted through the 100 plus cases to put the correct DG lit battery labels on them. as we were getting a weight on them I asked her multiple times if they were ready to be accepted. She said yes. we palletized the shipment so we could get an actual weight on it to process the rest of the awb. I advised her that we would be searching the shipment due to the nature of goods and that we were short staffed and would get to it as soon as possible. We have had multiple problems with this customer shipping with us out of Nome, they repeatedly tell us that they "shipped it here like this" - we found 17 cases that had issues. 7 cases have Lithium batteries, no label, terminals not protected, 1 case has 25lbs of lithium batteries. 1 case has 5 laptops no label 1 case has 2 cell phones no label 2 cases with power banks - 22lbs multiple cases with spare lithium batteries but not enough equipment and terminals not protected. and 2 batteries appear to be damaged. Nickel batteries with old DG/torn Dg labels on them 6 cases have lithium batteries no equipment, also found contraband/marijuana - troopers were notified and they confiscated it. loose 9v batteries, One case contained over 150 lithium batteries, the majority thrown together into plastic bags with no protection on terminals.

  • Carrier/Reporter: NORTHERN AIR CARGO, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On the evening of 09/01/22 Flt NC730 a shipment of Dangerous Goods arrived in Bethel on a ULD. After the cargo nets had been removed from the ULDs and the freight was being moved inside the warehouse an employee noticed a shipment had fallen off of the top of a stack of freight. 1. The employees’ were directed to not approach the shipment. 2. Time was given for any dangerous vapors to dissipate. 3. The shipment was restacked and moved to the farthest point on the property. 4. The possibly contaminated net and wrapping was moved to the same location. 5. The amount of the spill was determined to be approximately a cup or less of fluid. 6. The spill was diluted with water to keep it from being tracked into the building, and the containers were rinsed to keep anyone from accidentally touching the chemicals. 7. Consulted the ERG to make sure there were no further actions required.

  • Description: DG Admin was contacted on Sept 7th at approximately 0910 about a spill at the ANCR ramp location. It is unknown when the spill occurred, however the contents of the package, twenty undamaged plastic spray bottles and one damaged spray bottle were placed in a plastic bag, along with the shipping label that was cut off of the outer package, and was deposited in the DG hold area. One plastic bottle was damaged, with it's contents, classified as UN1760 corrosive liquids, n.o.s.(sodium metasilicate), 8, to leak, damaging the outer package. The outer package was not salvaged, but was disposed of prior to notifying DG Admin. DG Admin instructed the DG Specialist who contacted them to place the contents into a salvage drum and to await further disposition.

  • City: FAIRBANKS
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: US Ecology Transportation Solutions Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While transporting the tote of Sodium Hydroxide with a forklift to load it into a truck, the forklift traveled across uneven and rough terrain, which caused to tote to bounce and slide forward on the forks resulting in a fork creating a puncture to the bottom of the tote. The puncture was identified immediately. We then gently placed the tote on its side using the forklift and raised the tote up to a point where the hole was higher than the fluid contained within. We then placed a duck pond beneath the tote and began pumping the fluid into a clean / empty tote. After the fluids were transferred from the damaged tote, we began cleanup of the area.

item.title: Report I-2022100250
item.description:
Report I-2022100250

Identified by scraper @ 2023-04-08T21:09:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-25
  • City: Anchorage
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During the PM sort operations at the FedEx Express hub in Anchorage, AK a fibreboard box was observed leaking. Further investigation indicated the box contained possible undeclared dangerous goods. Per the associated SDS for the product epoxy Ultrabond 1300 it is fully regulated as UN2735 AMINES, LIQUID, CORROSIVE, N.O.S. technical name AMINOETHYLPIPERAZINE, 4NONYLPHENOL, BRANCHED PG III. There were no dangerous goods markings or labels on the packaging, and no Shippers Declaration for Dangerous Goods was offered with the shipment. Following spill cleanup, the involved package was placed inside of a salvage drum and help pending further disposition instructions.

item.title: Report I-2022090053

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-29

  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/29/2022 at approximately 0930, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 294822 at the ramp facility in Anchorage, reporting a flammable liquid spill. The shipment consisted of a wooden pallet with 6 plastic jerrican wrapped onto it. One of the jerrican sustained a small puncture, cause unknown, which resulted in leakage. The damaged jerrican was removed from the pallet and marked for disposal. The remainder of the shipment was rewrapped and awaited an amended declaration for further disposition.

item.title: Report I-2022090044
item.description:
Report I-2022090044

  • Incident Date: 2022-06-24
  • City: Anchorage
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was discovered at the Sort Center in the Anchorage Hub on June 24 at approximately 11am. The package was a fibreboard box that contained an all packed in one shipment containing one bottle of formaldehyde and four bottles of ethanol. Two of the plastic bottles containing ethanol were damaged causing the liquid to spill. It was contained by the absorbent pads and the box itself. The package was then placed in a salvage drum and any residual liquid was cleaned up. The drum is being held at the hub awaiting further instructions.

  • Description: Shipment was 'broken down' to 2pallets and sent through the xray. 2 totes on 1 pallet and the other 3pcs on another pallet. The first pallet went through the xray and the xray image looked like batteries. the 2nd pallet went through the xray and the xray image showed what looked like laptops. I opened all 4 totes and found the following: 1st tote: 4 boxes with UN3481 labels on each 2nd tote: 3 boxes with UN3481 labels on each, 3 galaxy tablets 3rd tote: 2 boxes with UN3481 labels on each, 3 ipads, 4 airpod pros, 2 galaxy buds pro 4th tote: 1 ipad, 2 galaxy tablets, 2 samsung tablets this was a 5piece shipment, 4/5 pieces contained undeclared lithium ion batteries. 1/2 sheet states nature of goods is 'electronics'. 4 totes are unmarked black totes with yellow lids that were zip tied shut.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE THAT NEEDED TO BE REWRAPPED. THE PACKAGE WAS SEALED WITH GLUE AND ARRIVED WITH AN OPEN FLAP AT THE BOTTOM OF THE BOX. AN INNER BOX WAS PROTRUDING REVEALING A LTD QTY MARK ON THE INNER BOX. INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS INSIDE THE LTD QTY MARKED INNER BOX REVEALED 1 BOX OF 25 DAISY POWER LINE CO2 PREMIUM CARTRIDGE CYLINDERS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THE PACKAGE WAS OFFERED TO THE UPS STORE BY JOSHUA WILKINS.
